TopicTitle: Why can't I adjust my trajectory?

Articles.Content:
Since 1.1 I've had a lot of trouble with flying my spaceships with the navigation node.

Specifically, I can't place a new navigation node on the trajectory, before an encounter, to adjust that encounter.

For some crazy reason I must first transfer into the other influence - and by then it's too late to achieve any valuable improvement.
- And the first navigation node is too inaccurate or too coarsely granulated to accomplish a desirable transfer trajectory to a distant target, like Jool or back..

It was on the very last drop I managed to get my last Laythe team back home. They made the outward bound journey before v1.0.5 and tried to get home on 1.1.1.
Usually, I slingshot from Tylo and adjust to get a close encounter with Kerbin. I could do neither this time. Luckily, the latest version of the rocket ship had the best fuel budget sofar and eventually managed anyway. On the last drop and came in hard enough to blow up some of the science during the reentry.

I want to fly my ships manually. I don't want to use Jebmech whatever to get precision. Flying manually used to be fun and rewarding. And I progressively increased my understanding of and feel for celestial mechanics. But right now it's just annoying and frustrating. And requiring huge amounts of fuel to compensate for the lack of accuracy or for the lateness of corrections.

I now have a few mods, but they are recent. I had this problem already before, on stock only. Before 1.1 I sometimes had this problem, but then I could usually make a navigation node farther away and then drag it backwards. This doesn't work anymore. Right now I'm totally screwed on an important test flight to Vall. Luckily it's an unmanned mission.

 

P.S. Okay, okay,.. a happier update. I figured to try advancing time a bit and reload the game. And this time I also loaded the 64-bit version, since that has worked fine for me when I've tried it lately. Anyway, I don't know why, but this time I could create a working navigation node and drag it backwards. So right now I'm good.  

 

Edited July 16, 2016 by Vermil
